Comments: It would have been nice if the person replying to my email had actually read my question before giving a half of an answer that was not actually helpful in the slightest! I wanted information about YA LGBTQ+ books in the RIF catalogue. I was given an answer about LGBTQ+ books in general in the larger catalogue. Also the search engine algorithm you use for some reason things that dragons are LGBTQ+ related by default (dragons are cool, but a book with dragons is not always inherently queer) and also thinks that "queen" is an adequate replacement for the word "queer." There's also no option to search both YA and LGBTQ at the same time.

I was offered a 10.00 off code and was not able to take it on the teacher side and I am no longer part of a Book Club, (the teacher retired).  So, therefore, the 10.00 off I am not able to use.   I also cannot find any Dr. Suess books.  Jeani Reagan  	Jeani,  Thanks for your Summer order. You’ve earned $10 in Back-to-School Cash to use in August or September for FREE Books!  Please save this email and use promo code at checkout: 3XFVEUUHR4 2072513693.

I've been a member of scholastic for years. I was very disappointed with your customer service. Throughout the pandemic you had no issues mailing orders to our homes. But could not make an exception to mail it one last time after I explained my school is closed for summer and I am due to have a baby in a week so I will not be traveling to work for some time due to maternity leave. I spoke with 3 or 4 different agents and no one had any compassion or anything nice to say. I really expected better. I will gladly take my business elsewhere.
I was just disappointed that my order was lost

My question was not answered nor was the issue resolved. I would like to know how the change to the digital flyer is helpful? It is super hard for me to find books that I'm looking for bc there is no monthly category to separate h the prices are super hard to see now (I wear glasses)

I placed an order for my child to have books by August 9th I was unaware that the order was not processed because the code was “expired” Alyssa is a first year teacher and she had no idea. I am so incredibly disappointed in how things turned out. The money came out of my bank and was placed back when I was unaware since they voiding fill the order. I didn’t have any communication whatsoever regarding my order until I reached out. If orders are not delivered during summer break something should be said before placing an order. I am extremely disappointed with the company for no forewarnings about the process.

I am really disappointed that Scholastic has decided to eliminate the Book of the Week and $1 and $2 books from the Book Club fliers.  There are many students at our school and in our district that simply cannot afford to purchase a book for $5 or more.  The dollar books allowed for organizations to purchase multiple copies and distribute them to kids in need.  It was always our goal to get books into the hands of students who needed them, and we felt Scholastic wanted something similar, and that's why there was a commitment to offering low cost books.
All though I received an answer I was not happy with the results.  My school is closed and I wanted my order delivered to my house and you would not do it.
Actually be able to help. I was given a phone number to call later

WE CONTINUE TO GET DUPLICATE BUNDLES OF THE BOOKLETS FOR TEACHERS. WE RECEIVED SEVERAL BUNDLES OF BOOKLETS FOR 2ND GRADE TEACHERS.   SCHOLASTIC ASK FOR TEACHER NAMES/ACCOUNT NUMBERS, HOWEVER THESE BUNDLES HAD ONLY "2ND gRADE TEACHER". SCHOLASTIC ASKED THAT I FORWARD THEM TO OTHER TEACHERS.   WE ALREADY HAVE BUNDLES FOR ALL OTHER TEACHERS.  THESE ARE EXTRA EXTRA BUNDLES. i AM ONLY TRYING TO CUT DOWN ON THE NUMBER OF BUNDLES COMING TO OUR SCHOOL UNNECESSARILY;   I HATE HAVING TO THROW THEM OUT

Consider the better choices for the bonus points store. I just suggested to have Apple products as a choice or gift cards to Best Buy or Target so teachers can choose for themselves as far as electronics. Many of the items in the store the school will purchase for our classrooms. Take into consideration adding more electronic options or gift cards into the bonus point catalog.

I was inquiring about trading in my points for a target gift card. I was disappointed to see that isn’t an option right now. Would love to see that brought back as we are always buying tho gs for our classroom through Target!

I have no issues with the nice rep I spoke with on Chat. My issues are with the changes made over past year or so. I'm old. I've been ordering from you since I was a baby teacher for over 28 years. I realize the world has changed - especially in the past 3 years... but taking away your best teacher incentives B2S 10K bonus points and eliminating the value packs/dollar deals has left many of my students unable to receive books. We don't qualify for Book Trust, but I should still be abe to put a book in the hands of each of my students. Scholastic always enabled me to do just that. Until now. Now I'm back to Book Box Day only being for those who can afford to order. I will be placing my last Back to School order in the next few weeks, but you've lost me as a loyal customer.
It was fine.. VERY DISAPPOINTED TO LEARN THERE WILL NOT BE ANY BIRTHDAY COUPONS THIS YEAR!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Teachers should be able to edit the scholastic due dates. To have those pre set and not be able to change them is very awful
I appreciated her clear communication. She was able to very clearly communicate the answer and made for a fast interaction.

I was disappointed that I had to pay shipping to my house. I know the shipping is free to my school but it’s closed right now. I was purchasing items to get ready for the school year and wanted them now rather than when school opens in 3 weeks.  Not a huge problem, just disappointed that there were no exceptions for the summer months. $10 is a lot for shipping.
I could not tell / find the Bonus Catalog.  Online there were so few choices.   Where is the Digital Bonus Points Catalog like you used to have?

The customer service agent I chatted with online was kind and professional, but I am disappointed at the change that Scholastic made which prompted me to reach out with a question.  My question was regarding the class due date.  I used to be able to choose my own class due date for scholastic orders.  It is now assigned for me with no way for me to edit it or change it.  The customer service rep explained that this a change made to streamline the process for teachers, but I actually liked having the option to choose my own due date.  For example, I'd appreciate having my due date for my first order at the end of August rather than mid-September.  I realize I can still order earlier, but now I'll have to write my own letter for families rather than using the one provided by Scholastic.  So, what was meant to save me a step will actually now require more of my time.  I'm disappointed. As I stated before, I'd like the ability to set or change the classroom due date to a date of my choosing rather than one that Scholastic assigns for me.

I teach virtually and do not see my students in person.  Last year they could order online and have it shipped to their house.  This year that option is gone.  I have been a customer for 25 years.  This might be the first year I can't use book orders.  Please allow my parents to order online and have it delivered to their house!
I had to go through many various prompts to get to the department I needed.  The one chat was not helpful.
I am a recently retired preschool teacher and I would like to say thank you Scholastic for 28 years of wonderful books that enhanced my classroom and encouraged my preschoolers to love books!
The customer service person, Ciara, did her job well. I was dismayed to see that the cost of the books increased so much, and the back to school incentives are not as generous for teachers.
Gotten my request with the first person versus the fourth Krista needs to be applauded/bonus for her effort!

I have been saving points for many years to have enough to get electronics in my classroom. I now have enough points and the points catalogue that you have this year is a huge disappointment. The reasoning behind pulling electronics from the catalogue is a joke as customer service told me that points were going to be "kidcentric." Very, Very dissatisfied and disappointed. I may not use Scholastic this year with my students and tell other teachers about this issue unless Scholastic reaches out to solve this issue for me quickly.

The link for the Teacher Sweepstakes does not work and I tried to communicate that to the chat person, however they just kept sending me the same broken link.  An error message pops up when you click on the link.  Both myself and my co-worker tried on 2 different computers so it's not just me.
They were vague. I think scholastic is trying to skirt around the fact that they are no longer offering affordable books for teachers to buy their students

Eliminating order forms is a classist practice that excludes many families that don't use credit cards/ online forms of payment. In order to keep participating in Scholastic Book Club (which I have done for the past 12 years) will require a huge amount of extra work for me to collect orders without forms. Your rationalization that eliminating cash orders in class will create less work for teachers is only true for teachers that serve populations with digital literacy and online financial capabilities.

Do not care for your new system of creating due dates. This new system does not meet the needs of my teachers and my school. Currently looking into other alternatives to replace Scholastic at my school. The quality of books offered has declined in recent years. Book Fairs have become more about peddling junkie trinkets than granting young students access to quality literature.

You could offer the birthday coupon books in the teachers store again. I want to be clear that the representative responding to my request was not the problem. That person gave me all the necessary information, was polite and respectful, and responded in a timely manner. I was not satisfied by the Scholastic's policy. I was very disappointed. I just wanted to make that clear.

I have not been happy with Scholastic for a very long time. I am a long time customer and if you look up my records, you will see how much I personally purchase each year, even during Covid. I am not happy with the latest news about no paper catalogs. It limits our families in an urban district to purchase books. I also find that there is not much of a variety of reasonably priced books for them either. I did in the previous slide. Really, please pay attention to urban districts too. Paper catalogs are more beneficial to them. Not all have access to the internet.

I expressed our disappointment that Scholastic has taken several steps regarding Book Clubs (no more $1 books, no more Dollar Book Store at checkout, no more Birthday book coupons) which will put books out of reach for many of our minority lower-income students.  I received a couple of responses and continued to ask questions.  The last two emails I sent were sent the exact same canned response, which was not responsive to my specific issues.  The last two canned identical responses were signed by different people - insulting in that it is clearly a canned response and not responsive to my concerns.
The customer service person was very good and knew how to change my account from one school to another.

Your staff gave me your company's answers to my questions clearly and promptly.  Your staff did the job you asked of them well.  I did not like the answers.  I do not like the way in which your company is changing book clubs and I am very frustrated by the changes the company has made to the program and online interface.
I am a bit surprised that we will not receive the first order forms until the end of August when so many schools start around here in August?

It wasn't the "overall experience" that was really my problem.  The customer service representatives were polite and answered the question very quickly.  My lack of satisfaction comes from the actual answer to my question. I am very, very, very, very disappointed that the $5 Birthday Book Pick coupons are no longer available.
Your representative was forwarding our chat to the management.  It is the new business model you have chosen to follow so there is nothing the representative could have done.
Happy the issue was resolved. Cashed check but didn't send books.

Very disappointed that books are so expensive.  I have raised money for the past few years to get my students dollar books each month.  It seems as though this is a thing of the past.  Sad that I will not be able to get books into the homes of my students.
Better communication in advance. I just found out the 1st book order is October. September is always our biggest order.
I wanted to change the date for my email from oct. to sept she said it set that way for less  work fo the educator, but parents aren't going want to want sept deadline in oct.
The dollar book store not being available has made me take my business elsewhere. I enjoyed  my services for year until now
My request is pending Bonus points no longer lists Target gift card option- my email was sent to corporate for reconsideration

It is disappointing that you no longer have dollar deals, the dollar deal store of bigger value packs for great prices. With the price increases I am not able to provide my students with as many books this year. Please bring back dollar deals and low priced sets and books so teachers can provide their students with more books!

There is nothing to do better with my last experience. My online chat was very informative. However, I did learn through the online chat that you would no longer be offering the $1 Store. That is disappointing. I realize prices are going up with everything; however, teacher’s salaries are not and it would be beneficial to help teachers since we are the ones that promote your company. I would like to see more packs of where you offer 5 books for $10 or 10 for $10. Those are extremely helpful to teachers!!! I also have glanced at the flyers online for September 2023. I do hope that there are some better deals for parents to purchase items because from what I viewed on your digital flyers, the prices are outrageous!!! If that is going to be the new normal, my orders will go down because parents can purchase much cheaper from elsewhere. Unfortunately, your sales will go down as well. I do hope that Scholastic can resolve this and make things affordable for the parent/child and for teachers.
My Scholastic team member was very helpful and friendly.  I enjoyed a very good experience talking with her.

Bring back the $1 book of the week and 5 books for $5 value packs! You’ve seriously upset so many teachers across the nation. You’ve really upset so many teacher across the nation. You should really reconsider bringing back the $1 book of the week and the 5 books for $5 value packs! It was so easy to get books in our students hands for when they don’t have the opportunity at home, especially those that aren’t economically advantaged. Now teachers are having to come up with double the amount. $1 price increase might not seem like a lot but when teachers were purchasing the $1 books for their 22+ students…that $1 increase adds up! Went from $22 a month to $44 a month. Please please please reconsider the $1 book of the week for the sake of the children.
Nothing to do with the customer service associate.
She didn't even answer the question that I did ask, just part of it.

I am very, very concerned that there are no longer *any* $1 books available in Scholastic book clubs. This is implying that inflation has risen 100% to move all $1 books to $2. Schools depend on those deals and many of us have been loyal to Scholastic for so, so many years and now we will not be able to afford the books for our students at a time they need them most.
The person who assisted me did a fine job. I was disappointed that the Birthday Coupons were no longer being offered. I have used them every year for 5 or 6 years.

I had three different interactions and the 3rd one was the most helpful to get my account straightened out. I tried to call and was told it would be a 2 minute wait time but I waited well over 15 minutes and finally gave up but thankfully Diane the 3rd agent cleared everything up and update my account correctly and I was able to place my order.

There still is not much to shop from in the Bonus Points catalog- poor and limited selection. The quality of the items has gone way down while the amount of points to get the item has gone up.  The PLASTIC utility cart will not last for very long in a Kindergarten classroom.

I've called multiple times to resolve my problem. The last call they forwarded me and i was on hold until the computer had me put in my phone number and someone would call me back. No one ever called me back. I've been trying since march to resolve my problem. Multiple phone calls, emails and it never gets resolved.

The scholastic representative was quick and professional but I never received the invoice I had requested. It was supposed to be sent to my school email but has never arrived. Could you please double check that it was sent to samantha_cook@k12.hi.us ? Thank you.
Well the rep could have let me use my remaining bonus points before  changing me to a parent as I retired.  I wanted to let a new teacher use my points to start her library.

Not drastically changed the bonus points offerings Very disappointed that many of the items i had been saving my bonus points for were taken away without any notice. So far I am not impressed with the offerings....It makes me not want to offer scholastic to my classroom families because it doesn't feel like the bonus points compensate for all the work and advertising that goes into it on my end. I wish we had been notified this was changing.

Your representatives were very faithful in responding to my questions and concerns, and made sure that all of my questions were answered, as well as making sure that my book box would be delivered to the correct location.

I received the info I needed, bit this should be available for all since ordering are no longer under teacher control. See previous answer. I believe exact information needs to be sent to teacher and also posted on the webpage so everyone knows and understands the changes in when books are ordered.
Short of solving the problem, nothing.

I messaged about the new bonus points catalog.  No gift cards.  No technology.  I've been saving my points for YEARS for bigger items, so I am extremely upset that I have all those points!  I have been moved to math, so I don't need any books.  Please give back the big items and gift cards for those loyal customers like me who have been helping your company make money all these years!
They never called me back. I waited 10 minutes for the recorded message that they would call me back and nothing!!
Your representative was very helpful and sent my problem on to the department that can help me.

Please update the website to reflect the name to be Julie Corpuz (not Tiffany Teele) on the account.  I inherited this account. I've changed the name on the details but it does not reflect on the Name Screen I seen on the website. Thank you!

My second question was not specifically answered, but I was able to infer an answer. My concern is that Scholastic is eliminating its Club Leo. Club Leo provided access to affordable books in the Spanish language and introduced world language and bilingual educator teachers and learners to authors and resources they may not otherwise know about. I have shared this unfortunate news with other language educators who are all equally saddened and disheartened by the news. Yes, your representative let me know that there are still Spanish-language books on the website, but this decreases accessibility, visibility, and even the variety of available Spanish-language books. Spanish is the second-most spoken language in the U.S. and the most commonly taught language other than English. I would request that Scholastic reconsider its decision as would many other language educators that I have now informed about this change.
The representative was rude about my concern about there only being one $2 book a month, which is too low for my students.

What I asked for he was able to help however the items that I really wanted were no longer available.  I am not sure why Scholastic keeps changing things every year!  These changes are making it harder and harder for teachers.  I am referring to no longer having 10 for 10 books, or the 6 packs of the same titles etc as well as changing our points store!  The items in the store are very limited. Please go back to what was offered last year
I was so disappointed that the price DOUBLED for the Judy Newman option. I understand that prices increase but DOUBLING?

The service on chat was professional.  Unfortunately, I’m sad and a little upset that the electronics and printer have been removed as items to purchase with our points. I’ve been a loyal customer and have been saving them for a big purchase. Will the printer and Apple items become available again? Teacher items. Please see previous comment
The $1 book per month for each kid in my class was discontinued this year without ANY warning.  I already had my classroom sponsored for the year by community members.
Bring back the 10 thousand bonus points You’re not bringing back the 10 thousand bonus points
The birthday book coupons will not be offered this year.
Have an unsubscribe form to make it easier to update and correct mailing lists. It hasn't been resolved because I will have to wait 90 days and after that see if the catalogs and mailings cease.

I am very disappointed by the lack of the 10,000 bonus points offer this August. I put off my order for school specially for this offer and to make sure I had money to order from you. Now with the lack of this offer this month I will not be ordering from you. I am very disappointed by the lack of the 10,000 bonus points offer this August. I put off my order for school specially for this offer and to make sure I had money to order from you. Now with the lack of this offer this month I will not be ordering from you.
I find the site very easy to navigate. Will place my order in September.
Scholastic is very user friendly. Customer service is always accomodating and helpful.
I just made a classroom order with my bonus points. Easy to navigate and excited to get my order for this upcoming school year!
I have alway enjoying visiting Scholastic web site.
Browsing books for the new year.  I will order soonl
Just used live chat for a $$ issue that was explained.
I am always happy to visit the scholastic website.
Looking forward to another great year with Scholastic!
I love using scholastic and how easy it is!
I like how easy this website is.
I was updating account information and introducing new teachers to Scholastic.
I really enjoy ordering from scholastic book stores.
excellent resources of books for all leveled readers, fantastic rewards for educators and students and fabulous prices!

I am the STEM Coordinator at my school and I wanted to see the STEM books. I also have 20,000 points because I have used Scholastic with my 2nd grade students for 38 years and I have racked up tons of points. I am now the STEM Coordinator for the last 3 years.  I am also a New Teacher Mentor, so I am using my points this year to help them stock up on good books for their classrooms.
Getting everything ready for the beginning of the year.
WOW! Much higher prices than the past!

I'm very upset that the monthly $1 books and the 5 books for $5 deals are gone. I was able to use these books to supply my students with new books each month, now it will be nearly impossible to do on a regular basis. I hope to see this return in the near future.
Scholastic Book Clubs is wonderful.  Your company takes great care of its customers.
Stopped doing book orders for class because of delivery issues and billing issues.  The customer service to fix these problems was not good either.
Easy to navigate the site and now I have an idea about what books to order as our school year begins. Browsing is helpful and my kiddo loves being a part of the process.
Thank you for the wonderful and satisfying experiences you gave me during my time as a Teacher, and I am looking forward to continuing with you as a Grandparent!
Looking to gets books into the hands of 25 students. To begin their library at home. Looking for Book of the Week.

Taking away the autonomy for teachers to set their own due dates is very disappointing. I make those due dates based on holidays, new units, etc. It is extremely disappointing to see that feature gone.
Very easy to navigate, learning how to set up monthly paper scholastic flyers is a bit complicated though.
I can't figure out how to change the due date of my first book order.  I was trying to make it Sept 12, 2023.  It is set at an October date.  I guess that will be my first monthly order.

Please reconsider prepopulating the due dates automatically on our bookorders.  I understand that the monthly orders are  due by a certain date, but sometimes we send two months at at time..      This is so absurd that you feel you need to dictate the due dates.
I would like for you to send flyers for my students. I have about 30 students in my class.  I would appreciate it.  Thanks,  Mrs. Scott
could not pay an outstanding balanced
I have a class code to be able to order books but there isn't a place to enter it. This site is not user friendly.
Clicking on Keep shopping took me nowhere.

I could only find 1 book that was $2.  All of the other books were $3 or more.  I couldn't figure out how to activate the dollar store and I couldn't find the dollar pick of the week.  I called Scholastic and a very nice lady explained the new changes to me.  I totally understand... I am just going to miss Scholastic's super low prices.

There doesn't seem to be a way to modify my order due date to match my timeframe. It's also disappointing that there's only one catalog/flyer available that is the K/1. I'd prefer just a 1st grade flyer like in the past. My experience today is rather disappointing and has me questioning if I want to continue to use Scholastic Book Club.
I am unable to change the due date. It is listed as October 11.
I think the family due date is too long for students to wait for their book for this first flyer,
I am really hoping you bring back the 5 for $5 deals or the dollar store.
I was looking for Warriors and Series of Unfortunate Events both of which were unavailable through scholastic at this time.
I wish there were still $1/$2 books available for my 4th graders
I would like an option to print out parent letter in Spanish, since the majority of my parents are Spanish speakers.

I was not able to find books I wanted -- maybe they are not available anymore. The book prices have gone up so much that I won't be able to purchase many books this year. I don't like that we get so FEW bonus points also this year compared to other year's.
Where are the flyers for the book clubs?  What is on the website right now is not what I was looking for.

Would like flyers to be sent to my school. I find parents order when they are able to browse through a hard copy of book choices.  I also have the children browse and make choices for our classroom.  One way I initiate book conversations and accountable talk.

I had a bunch of items in my cart back in July and went back to place my order and I wasn't allowed access due to updates until August 1.  Then all my items in my cart were gone and many items I wanted to purchase are no longer available.  PLEASE communicate this with us through a simple e-mail.  I would have placed my order earlier had I known!      I'm here today because I went to change my email address and update school info yesterday as I am in the process of changing districts/schools and my account changed to a parent account... why?! Had to call in this morning to get this fixed!! I used to love Scholastic but lately it's declining in it's services not improving!!!
EEEEEKKKKK! Prices are horrible! What happened to dollar books???? I know prices have gone up, then how about $2.00 books? And not all parents are tech savvy to order thru the computer.
I was hoping to find value packs priced similarly to last year. Prices have increased
Your 'bonus points' catalog is even worse in choices than it was last year.    No $1 books?!  What?!  Lots of overpriced items.      Really dissatisfied with what I'm seeing from scholastic.
I want to change the date for my orders and am unable. The site has Sept 27. I want Sept 1st. Very frustrating.

I was not able to find the Bonus Points Catalog when I put it into the search button nor when I tried to access it through your site map.   What I found was just a few books, a library shelf,  some games etc.  In the past you had a much more extensive catalog both online and one that was mailed to me.
Is there Dollar Store opportunities anymore????  Please have a rep email me to update on Dollar Store.
I do not like the way the big box comes up and blocks my view each time I hit the STAR to recommend a book.
I am really hoping for a bigger variety of items in the Bonus Catalog.  There seems to be very few options this year and that is very disappointing.
None of the three titles I was looking for were available. I was hoping to purchase, "The Wild Robot Escapes," "The Fantastic Mr. Fox," and "James and the Giant Peach."
I want to set a due date for my first order and I can't find where to do that it is already set for October and that is later than I want.
I do not like that you have to pay almost $7.00 in shipping if you want to use your points on an order. I have over 3,000 points, but I do not want to have to pay shipping expenses to use my points.
Why can I no longer change my order date?

I know with inflation that book prices are expensive. I was disappointed in the choice of books to get in my students hands. Our school district has over 60% on a free or reduced lunch program. I feel without more affordable choices I many flyers.

I can only see a pre-set due date on the website when parents go in to view the page.  I can customize my letter but I also need to customize the web page.      If this change is new with a preselected due date, I will be disappointed.

The books overall seem to have increase significantly. That will price most families out of being able to purchase for their children. It is saddening. I have used Scholastic for 28 years. I will likely not have many orders from parents this year due to the cost. Such a large company should be able to make ordering for families possible with lower costs.
It seems more difficult to get back to main home page.    I do not like the pre selected due date feature!

One of the main incentive for me to order from Scholastic was the beginning of the year Bonus Points deal. I order throughout the year to use those bonus points. Moving from 5 bonus points for every dollar from orders over $300 get 10,000 bonus points is a huge disappointment. You are reducing my bonus points from 10,000 to 1,500. The selection of books has also been reduced drastically. I have been a golden apple teacher for years, but it is to the point now where Scholastic is not worth the amount of time it takes to send flyers and reminders, and collect money, and then sort and pass out books... I am not sure I will use Scholastic anymore.
I'm trying to make sure I get catalogs for my students this year so that we can place monthly orders again.
Can't find the bonus point catalog.

I'd like to edit the ordering dates. Why the change? If the dates suit my schedule, we're likely to order more. For example, my school will host a book fair during October conferences. I'd like to establish the book club ordering program with a September order before the book fair is advertised. The book club program has transitioned over the years to become more online ordering by parents, and if I can't manage the online date, I'll have to rely on parents paying attention to my messaging about amending it...

Please bring back the value packs with the same book. It used to be 10 for $10 and then it switched to 5 for $7 then it went back to 10 for $10 and now  I don't even see that option anymore. The kids really loved those value packs.
Not sure I am loving the format or the new flyers.
Not happy with prices of books this year or lack of bonus points
I am trying to order catalogs for the beginning of the year and there is no place to enter amounts or places to choose grades/catalogs.
Do not like to greatly reduced number of items, especially electronics in the Bonus Points area and the cash prices for items are absolutely ridiculous

For the last 3 years I have tried to request catalogs for our homeschool CO-OP group. We have students from preschool to high school. I have been unsuccessful every year. I have called the beginning of each year looking for help, still nothing. I'm very unhappy with the service, we as homeschoolers have received.
You need to expand your offering of books.

Overall, I am a bit disappointed with changes for this coming school year.  I feel like the catalogs offer less options for families...and there is very little under $5.  I was disappointed to see that there were next to no options for $1-3 even offered.  I often buy sets for my students and like to see good, quality titles at a more reasonable rate when purchasing 30+ books and I didn't even see teacher offers with large packs for a class or $1 books offered, despite the popularity of those options in the past several years.

I haven't ordered in a while and with a new grade change I thought I'd checkout the variety of books in your collection.  I was trying to see if there were other items offered to teachers that could be used with their bonus points but I didn't locate that yet. I'm sure there have been changes so I will continue to explore the website to see what I may find.  Thank you
The two boxes of broken crayons were sent back - I still do not see my1125  bonus points put back to my account.  Kathy kautz Account #5189123

I am trying to figure out why I received ZERO paper flyers in the mail to send home with students last year, while my colleagues did.  How do I begin to receive them again?   Without them, I find way fewer kids order!
Can find my classroom code to update the letter in goggle Classroom
Looking for introduction letter for parents
I couldn't find dollar deals for class sets.  I was disappointed that the special points x5 required I give you the parent's email.
Disappointed with current selection of books. Few classics, mostly pop culture ike selections.
Can you send me the hardcopy of the catalog for September so I can send it home to families when school starts? I would need the K-2 book orders. Thank you.
I was ready to use my points for a new microwave, but I can't find it. Also, the Target gift cards. I wish I knew the points rewards were changing. I would have used up all my points last year.

I am already not liking the new site.  I know my students and parents.  If the only way to get them to order is by going online to do it, I will not get any orders.  It is easier as it was before.  Students get a flyer, bring me the cash, and I place the orders.  Why was this option removed? Asking me to call in and place an order is not convenient .  I am sure I am not the only teacher already frustrated with this.  I can't get my parents to read my emails therefore I know this will not happen.  Is there a way you can revert back or at least let us decide what option to use.  I used to put my orders together at night at home and late after tending to my family. Sometimes 10:00-11:00pm CA time.  I seriously doubt you will be in so I can CALL???? and place an order.

More of a disappointment. For the last 5 years I have done Scholastic orders to get $300 in the first month of school to get 10,000 bonus points. Its my favorite time of the year and allows me to get free books for my students each holiday through the year. I am sad that there is not option to get this bonus. If there is an option still I would love to know.

None of the current books that I want to order are on your site.  Also, it is very frustrating to have to sign in with a complicated school email EVERY time I want to order books.  I'd also appreciate a tab in finalizing an order that states to pay the shipping out of a current credit.  It's senseless to charge for shipping when credit is available in my account.
They do not have the Leo catalog available
I was looking for furniture for our library area.  Not much to select from.
I just wish you would go back to $1 books.
The changes are difficult to navigate and will take some time to get used to.  More time consuming than before, not user friendly as of right now.
The books I was searching for were not there.
I could not request a set of flyers for my class for the beginning of the year.
Trying to see how I can bonus points that I have from very previous orders (years past)
Went to request flyers and couldn't find where the required fields were to make request.
I will be ordering books. I just did not have enough time to complete my order at the moment.
I have moved to middle school.  I now teach 7th & 8th grade English.  I want interesting yet challenging reading books for middle schoolers.
Not a fan of the new flyers, or better yet, the lack thereof. Not very many choices in the flyers this year. Where are the Club Leo flyers?

I teach a Dual Immersion Spanish class.  I was looking for your Club Leo flyer to recommend parents take a look at it to order Spanish books.  It's frustrating to find that you don't have the flyer ready for the beginning of the school year.
Books are still high in price for my classroom.  I am looking to find a better deal for the large amount of students I have throughout the district.  I may be back to visit this website soon.
Where can I find the Club Leo catalog?

I did not find any resources for high school students. The offerings end with middle school. I teach high school and college freshmen English courses, so my goal of obtaining books for my students was not accomplished.
Not always "user friendly".   Can sometimes be difficult to find desired information.
Can we no longer set our own due dates?
The bonus point catalog seems to be missing. It was difficult to find the bonus point selections due to this new format. I did not find it user friendly or helpful.

Greatly disappointed by your new flyer format.and the greatly limited selections. Why is there no longer a club Leo  or the diversity flyer. Prices have also dramatically risen and rewards have decreased. It saddens me that as a golden apple custumer in the past, I saw nothing that I can use this school year. I will not send out the flyers as the multicultural  options are so limited and the prices too high for my families.

I wasn't able to find the Birthday Coupon Book that I purchase for my students.  I was also saddened to see many of the prices have gone up.  Are we no longer able to enter our student orders?  Do families now have to do this online?
are you doing away with the weekly dollar books?
The site worked perfectly. I was very surprised at the change in price points on the books and am not sure how much I will be able to order this year.
I saw the due date for parents and could not find how to change the due date to be sooner than listed.

As I am searching through the site for the new year, I am continually disappointed with each page I browse.     For the last 10 years, I have fundraised so that I could purchase books for my student. I collect $10 per child and use those funds to purchase monthly books for my students. There used to be a $1 book each month. Then those were phased out, and the $1 book of the week was fine usually. It was also nice to have the 5-book packs and the 10-book packs for $5 and $10 respectively.  I typically spend enough at Scholastic that I was also able to shop the $1 book store after spending the required amount. Through all of these ways, I have been able to  provide my students with a brand new book each month.      This year, I will not be able to do it. I have raised $300, but there are no $1 or equivalent book offers. Prices on the books are the same as Amazon, if not higher. I will have to raise at least double what I raised to even get whatever $2 book, and it's just not worth it.

I am really disappointed in the changes to the bonus points program. I save and fundraise every year so that I can make a $300+ purchase and earn 10,000 Bonus Points. I purchased books to give to my students to build their home libraries, as well as purchased books to keep my classroom library relevant and exciting. I saved and used the bonus points to get items like seat sacks, flexible seating, and other classroom necessities. Now, that same purchase will only earn me 2,500 bonus points, which is a drastic cut. The items in the bonus store are so expensive, it will take years to earn the same amount of points. The changes over the last couple of years are making me rethink my relationship with Scholastic.

I was not able to enter the due dates I wanted. I Chated with an employee, and after some difficulty, I finally got them to understand my question. But I think your company needs to send a letter or email that states there has been a change to due dates and then give us the dates orders are due so we can reword the communications home to families.
unable to figure out how to change the due date for parents

I miss the value packs where it is the same book for either 10 for $10 or 5 for $5. As a teacher, I love buying books for my students monthly and without those deals or packs, I am unable to do that anymore. It seems since the update that happened they disappeared. Please consider brining them back to at least the teachers so we can continue to gift our students or have our class read aloud sets/small group books.

I was looking for 2 books that I've order from here for years and you no longer carry them.  The Night Before Preschool and The Kissing Hand.   I am so disappointed.  I give them to my preschool children before school starts to help make their transition easier.
I am trying to verify my class code.  It has been hard to find.
Items that were in my cart to order are all gone.  Additionally a lot of items are no longer available.

I'm trying to find the birthday coupons for the students. And I'm going to be really sad if I find out that scholastic has changed their products and is no longer offering the 30 coupon birthday books package. Also, I'm trying to find information on the 10,000 point challenge which has been offered by scholastic for at least the last 10 years. It says the current month's challenge only goes up to $200 and does not include the 10,000 points. Something like only 1,000. If scholastic has now stopped the birthday coupons and the 10,000 point challenge, this will be a strikeout and I will not be using scholastic this year. Seems like they are taking away all the good things just to save a little bit of money. 😞
I can not find my son's favourite book
Hello, I was disappointed to see that you don't have an option to ship to your home or your workplace/school. I really wish that this option was back again. Please reconsider.

raising your book prices each year from $1.00 to $1.50 to $2.00 is a sad thing to do. I work for a non profit low income school and my families are not able to afford these books. Out of the kindness of family members, friends, and community members, they sponsor my students. First, I asked for $10.00 per student, then $15.00, now, $20.00...  The prices keep increasing and I am not going to be able to continue to purchase books for my students.  Please, consider going back to $1.00 books.

I really miss the $1 books that did not have any requirements. As a teacher, I would buy those for my kiddos every month and now I can't afford to. I know you have the $1 books once you spend so much but that is not as easy as you think it is. It just stinks for teachers who loved buying books for their kiddos and can't anymore :(

I would like to be able to find books in a specific price range however, I am having a lot of difficulty sorting by price without scrolling through every book available. I am on a budget and I want to buy books for my students. I cannot afford $3-$4+/book for 75 students.

I am not a fan of the new updates to the site. I'm rather perplexed at the way things are now structured and worry that parents will be less likely to order from the site. While I understand the drive to move digitally, it is a disservice to low income families to eliminate the paper order form.

Disappointed there is only one book that is $2 , a few books that $2.99 and majority cost more.  Worried my families won't be able to purchase books.  Hopefully more will be added and will check back.
There are no back to school books that I am able to get for my students back to school gifts. This is disappointing. I will reconsider sending scholastic orders home this year.
I haven't used my scholastic account in over 2 years - I went on the site to use my bonus points and order.  My bonus points are gone...

So disappointed that your beginning of the year rewards have DRASTICALLY reduced.  I am used to earning 10,000 bonus points every September with huge class orders.    Seems like there is little to no incentive for me to push your products this year.  After the shipping/order debacle of two years ago, I think it is too soon for your to be drastically changing the rewards that have existed for the 25 years I have been ordering.
It is disappointing not to be able to provide catalogs for the students at the beginning of the year.

For the last several years I have gotten donation of $10 from friends and families and have been able to purchase 1 book per month for 30 students for at least 6-7 months.  I have purchased the 10 pack books.  I didn't see them on the site this year.  I collected way less money this year and I will have to look elsewhere to purchase books this year.   I know you are in the money making business but I wish you had a few cheaper options for students who can't afford  to purchase $4 books.  It doesn't seem like much but it is!

I wanted to place an order and use some bonus points to get a few things- a laminator, extra lamination sheets, a 10 rolling cart, magnetic hooks, and the utility cart.  I was VERY disappointed! The only thing I was able to find was the laminator.  There is no longer any extra lamination sheets to buy. The utility cart is now plastic- AND it is more expensive!  I am not interested in wasting my money/points on something that will not last.  There are hardly any choices to pick from  in the bonus points section. When I look at an item and go back, there are new things to look at- I would like to be able to see all of my options whether they are listed by category or not.  I am not a a fan of this new part.  It is very disappointing to push for parents to buy books from here and those books be a great value and then see that the bonus points section has less options and quality and yet the amount to spend is even more.  I am not sure that I will even send out my flyers this year because
Parents are complaining that prices are too high.

The prices have increased and the selection is more limited.
I used to be able to set my own order due date and print out labels with our class code to send home with a flyer.  I don't see that any more.
I cannot see how to delete my account.

I am really disappointed to see that the back-to-school book orders this year don't have the BIG bonus points associated with them. I am hoping that they come back later in the year. As a teacher that provides lots of free books to students that otherwise wouldn't have them, I simply can't afford to do so without bonus points. I also get that inflation is a "thing" but a lot of the books in the catalog are no longer within the price point that families are looking for.
I am looking for sets of books and cant find it.

I hope to get back to monthly orders after COVID issues.

Disappointed that birthday coupons are gone.     Go back to having books end in .00 .50, or .75 price wise.     Overall very disappointed in the direction that Scholastic has taken over the past couple of years.
When I entered my new email address it would not enter.  I had to exit and reenter the site.

It is difficult to navigate-more so than it used to be. I'm sure it's been streamlined over the years but you don't know that you have extra funds to spend (from placing an order) until you place the order, then it awkwardly takes you back to the ordering page to do it. Just tricky.

I'm sure that for 99% of the teachers they are so thankful for the changes to the website and the easier way to place classroom orders. I'm a very small preschool in a very rural part of Indiana. My parents are low income/poverty level people. They want something better for their children and want to buy books but can't always afford to. I order for my students on most of my orders so everyone gets a book a few times a year. I'm concerned about parents knowing who paid for their child's book. I wish there were a way that parents could pay me and I would turn in the order so no one would know if a parent didn't pay me.
I am not a fan of the new format for flyers.

I'm getting ready to go back to school so I logged in to check on my account. I was very surprised that there isn't a classroom code anymore. I'm wondering why? I'm wondering how the process will be for parents without the code?

Sorry to see the YA category disappear.

So disappointed in the lack of lower cost books! Scholastic is taking books out of student's hands by discontinuing the books under $2. I have a budget for books for my students but I will be taking it elsewhere after I spend the remainder of my points.
Where did all the Spanish books go? There's like 6 choices for each age now. No flyer anymore, either??
You need a new UX designer. Finding simple things like how to change due dates is difficult and frustrating. The entire navigation of the site needs re done.

This is the second time that I have been given an outstanding balance within a year. I understand that shipping is charged on some orders, however it should not be something that is asked for months after an order. If shipping is required to be paid, you should have asked a customer at the time of checkout. I will no longer be using scholastic in my classroom.

I'm trying to find out what order has an outstanding balance. I don't know if it was a parent order or a classroom order, but the order history does not give that information. I wasn't able to order paper fliers for my kindergarteners and when I called was told they would be sent later this month automatically. I had wanted to have them for our back to school night event and they will not arrive in time.    I did not see a section for the dollar bookstore which has been vital to me providing books for my students. I ordered books for gifts for the first day a few months ago and was just told that my numbers changed. When I called customer service, I was told that dollar books will no longer be offered. I am EXTREMELY disappointed. I have 56 students and every year for the last 12 years of my career I have ordered books as gifts for them and I'm very disappointed to learn that this will no be out of my budget as books will no longer be offered for a dollar for teachers to purchase. It's incredibly disappointing that a dollar book is no longer offered ( or the 10 for $10 book packs) for teachers to purchase.  I've been a customer for years, and my ultimate goal is to get as many books in my students hands as possible. The fact that this is now basically unattainable for under $2 a book  is so sad to me. I used to brag about scholastic books!

Hoping Scholastic offers the value packs so I can get monthly books for each student.  The 5 for $5 and 10 for $10 was super nice last year, and my students LOVED getting a book at the beginning of each month!

I have families that are struggling financially & it is impossible for them to afford a simple book because there are none that are $1 anymore.   More families & more teachers would place orders if $1 books were made available again.  It takes too long to manage the book order and not get any orders/points.  Please make books affordable to the low income families again.

I loved purchasing classroom books from your $1 or even $2 selections.  These are gone now and I do not like that I have to buy a random $100 before the secret store opens.  I’ve been using scholastic for 25 years and this seems ridiculous to me.

There is no longer a Bonus Catalog to spend bonus points.  I was only able to see a few items at a time.  In order to find other items, I had to click one of the few presented.  Even then, it was showing the same items over and over.

I was anxious to see the new selections for back-to-school. However, I am surprised and disappointed at the increased pricing and lack of lower priced books. Usually there are back-to-school specials for the teachers also, such as a $1 deals or $10 for 10 pack of a title. I didn't find anything like that. I have relied on those offers to build my classroom library and to provide welcome back gifts and rewards to the students. It looks like a lot has been streamlined and less offered.

Scholastic has made it very difficult for teachers to purchase books for their students by not having any $1 books or even $2 for that matter. I used to love getting books as a child and it’s almost impossible nowadays. As I teacher, I would appreciate it if we got the option to purchase cheaper books for our classroom.
do not like that multiple flyers are not offered.
I am very upset to learn that there will be no $1 book of the weeks. Working in a low income district, not having cheap books hurts my young readers tremendously.

I am really disappointed with the new flyers.  There is too much fluff and not enough books.  There are not any books offered for under $3.99.  I can't buy any for my class.  The book of the month is not a great choice for younger students.  I have been a fan of Scholastic for over 20 years.  This is terrible.  I am very saddened and may have to stop promoting your flyers.  If you are going to continue on this path, I will not recommend book orders to teachers or parents.
I am very disappointed you are not offering the birthday coupon books for teachers this year.

Could not find bonus point catalog. I went to the FAQ and found the answer on how to access it but all it kept showing were trending items and new this month items.     Also so sad to see how much the prices have increased.  When you work in a school that has lower socioeconomic families it was nice to have the $1 options and then kids felt so proud to be able say the ordered a book from the book order,  It also makes it difficult for me to ask for people to sponsor my students to get books as I am asking for at least $40 per child and that seems like a lot of money to ask from families.

very difficult to find the bonus points and catalog, very confusing    I'm very disappointed as I have been saving up bonus points for a technology item and now it's not available - very little is available in technology. Parents are forced to order online and not all parents want to submit online orders. I'm not sure I'll use scholastic book clubs this year.

I think I went in to the wrong section. I just wanted to order a book without tying it to a teacher because our teacher assignments are not out yet and I wanted to get a headstart on reading before the school year starts. But I can't order here without that so I need to check my URL

I'm not sure that I like NOT being able to chose my own due date for parent orders, based on what's happening at our school. I will see how it goes this year with your shipping when everyone is turning in orders at the same time.
Wanted to see the new bonus point catalog, but it doesn't appear to be available yet. Just seems like a few items are available.

I was looking for some diverse back to school books for the new year, recommended by other teachers, and I was not able to find a single book on this site. They are all available on  Amazon, but I rather order here to get points for my class.

Did not like the new layout of the website.  Also do not like that it looks like the differnt $1 books are gone and the 10 for $10 packs. Have more dollar books.  Many families can't afford to buy and teachers are buying out of their own pockets.

I really wish we'd go back to the monthly book order forms and not just 6 times a year.

I really was coming to order my class a $1 book... I have done this for 3 years (one book per month) and either bought a dollar book or two sets of 10 for $10 books... I am very dissatisfied to see this is not an option.

The site can be hard to navigate when looking for specific things.     I was also disappointed to find that the selections available for bonus points are much more limited than in previous years, especially with regard to AV/tech offerings!

I feel like the website looks different in some places and is less user friendly. I do appreciate that Clubs is mostly the same as last year unlike Fairs which I currently want to throw through a window.

I've always loved Scholastic and really appreciated the deals. I usually purchase the sets of multiple copies, but... I guess they don't exist anymore? I usually do a big push at the beginning of the year for my parents to buy books so that our class can get points. It looks like I won't be doing that this year. The prices are too high, the amount of points we earn are too low, and the point cost for book sets SO MUCH MORE than it was even just last year! I understand that the economy has been tough, but if this is the direction that Scholastic is going, I guess I won't be buying books for my class anymore. :(
Had a hard time selecting books i want to buy..

This new switch in ordering has not been explained well.  Instead of just entering a class code, parents must now create accounts and search for the school and teacher.  On the front end, this seems much more complicated.  We do one order for our whole school, not individual teachers.    I gave it a test run.  Our school is listed twice.  There is a teacher option available even though she no longer works for us.  I do not know how to fix these things that may lead parents to order in the wrong place.  A sample letter to parents explaining all of these changes would have been nice.  Also, as the site administrator, clear explanations of all changes along with instructions would have been very helpful, rather than me wasting time in the preparation weeks for school starting, muddling through trying to figure it out.  I understand the need for deadlines, but having preset deadlines without considerations of important events on our school calendar seems like an obsticle.  We will still ne
